Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
CAN: The student can draw animals like fish or deer, but placement might not be habitat-appropriate (e.g., fish next to a tree).
The student can attempt to label animals (e.g., writing 'fish' near the drawing of the fish).
CANNOT: The student cannot consistently show animals in appropriate habitats (e.g., fish on land) *(misunderstands where animals live)*.
The student is unlikely to include plants or correctly associate them with habitats *(lacks understanding of ecosystems)*.
The student may not label what plants and animals need to survive (e.g., no mention of water or sunlight) *(unaware of survival needs)*.
The student cannot demonstrate how habitats provide necessary resources *(doesn't show resources like water for fish)*.
The student cannot illustrate relationships between living things and their environments in a meaningful way *(no clear habitat-system depiction)*.
